abstract: New York City's Campaign Finance Board fines former Congressman Anthony D Weiner $65,000 for violations during his failed mayoral bid in 2013, saying he used campaign funds to buy cellphones during Democratic primary; Weiner will also have to return his campaign's remaining balance of $195,000, which board says is unspent public matching funds.

headline.print_headline: Board Fines Weiner $65,000 for ’13 Campaign Violations
headline.main: Anthony Weiner Fined $65,000 for Campaign Finance Violations

snippet: The penalty was levied by New York City’s Campaign Finance Board, which said the former congressman violated the rules during his failed mayoral bid in 2013....
lead_paragraph: The penalty was levied by New York City’s Campaign Finance Board, which said the former congressman violated the rules during his failed mayoral bid in 2013.
